gurmukhi: AYso ko FIT krY ijX mo niRp swmuih jw bqIXw ieh BwKY ] Sok BrI murJwie igrI DrnI pr so bqIAwN nih BwKY ]794]
transliteration: Aiso Ko Dheeth Darai Jiya Mo Nrip Saamuh(i) Jaa Bateeya Eh Bhaakhai|| Shok Bharimurjhaae Murjhaae Giridharnidar So Bateeaan Nah(i) Bhaakhai||794||
translation: “Is there any courageous person, who may present my anguish before the king,” saying this, Yashoda, withered by sorrow, fell down on the ground and became silent.794.

gurmukhi: bwrh mws riKXo audry mih qyrih mws Bey joaU j`eIXw ] pwl bfo ju krXo qbhI hir ko sun mY muslIDr B`Xw ]
transliteration: Baarah Maas Rakhiyo Udre Maih Terah(i) Maas Bhae Jooo Jaeeyaa|| Paal Bado Ju Daryo Tab-hiko Soun Mai Mousleedhar Bhayyaa||
translation: “I kept Krishna in my womb for twelve months; O Balram! listen, I have sustained and nourished Krishna to this age;

gurmukhi: qwhI ky kwj ikDO niRpvw bsudyv ko kY suq bol pT`eIXw ] pY hmry Gt Bwgn ky Gr BIqr pY nhI sXwm rh`eIXw ]795]
transliteration: Tahike Kaaj Kidhau Nripvaa Basudev Ko Kai Sout Bol Pathaeeyaa|| Pai Hamre Ghat Bhaagad Ke Gad Bheetar Pai Nahisyaam Rahaeeyaa||795||
translation: “Has Kansa called him for this reason, considering him as the son of Vasudeva? Has my fortune, in reality, dwindled away, that Krishna will now onward not live in my house?”795.

gurmukhi: rQ aUpr mhwrwj gy rQ cV kY qij gRyh ] goipin kQw biRlwp kI BeI sMq sun lyh ]796]
transliteration: Rath Oopar Mahaaraj Ge Rath Chad Kai Taj(i) Greh|| Gopin(i) Kathaa Brilaap Kibhaisant Soun Leh796||
translation: Leaving his home, Krishna mounted the chariot: now O friends! listen to the story of the gopis.796.

gurmukhi: jb hI cilby kI sunI bqIXw qb gÍwrin nYn qy nIr FrXo ] ignqI iqn ky mn bIc BeI mn ko sB AwnMd dUr krXo ]
transliteration: Jah Hichal(i)be Kisounibateeyaa Tah Gvaaran(i) Nain Te Neer Ddaryo|| Gintitin Ke Man Beech Bhaiman Ko Sabh Aanand Door Daryo||
translation: When the gopis heard about the departure of Krishna, their eyes were filled with tears, many doubts arose in their mind and the happiness of their mind ended;

gurmukhi: ijqno iqn mY rs jobn Qo duK kI soeI eIDn mwih jrXo ] iqn qy nhI boilXo jwq kCU mn kwnH kI pRIq ko sMg jrXo ]797]
transliteration: Jitno Tin Mai Ras Joban Tho Doukh Kisoieedhan Maah(i) Daryo|| Tin Te Nahiboliyo Jaat Kachhodh Man Kaahn Kipreet Ko San Daryo||797||
translation: Whatever passionate love and youth they had, the same was burnt to ashes in the fire of sorrow; their mind has withered so much in the love of Krishna that now it has become difficult for them to speak.797.

gurmukhi: jw sMg gwvq QI imil gIq krY imil kY ijh sMg AKwry ] jw ihq logn hws shXo iqh sMMig iPrY nih SMk ibcwry ]
transliteration: Jaa San Gadvat Thigeet Darai Mil(i) Kai Jih San Akhdare|| Jaa Hit Logad Haar Sahyo Tih San(i) Phirai Nah(i) Shank Bichdare||
translation: With whom, and whose arena, they used to sing together, for whom, they endured the ridicule of the people, but still they undoubtedly roamed with him;

gurmukhi: jw hmro Aiq hI ihq kY lir Awp blI iqn dYq pCwry ] so qij kY biRj mMfl kau sjnI mQurw hU kI Er pDwry ]798]
transliteration: Jaa Hamro At(i) Hihit Kai Lar(i) Aap Balitin Dait Pachhdare|| So Taj(i) Kai Brij Mandal Kau Sajnimathuraa Hoo Kior Padhdare||798||
translation: He, who knocked down many mighty demons for our welfare, O friend! the same Krishna, forsaking the land of Braja, is going towards Mathura.798.

gurmukhi: jwhI ky sMg suno sjnI hmro jmunw qt nyhu BXo hY ] qwhI ky bIc rhXo gf kY iqh qy nhI CUtn nYku gXo hY ]
transliteration: Jaahike San Souno Sajnihamro Jamounnda Tat Neh(u) Bhayo Hai|| Tahike Beech Rahyo Gad Kai Tih Te Nahichhodhtan Naik(u) Gado Hai||
translation: O friends! with whom, we have been absorbed in love on the bank of Yamuna, he is now firmly established in our mind and does not go out of it;
